back_cards.definition_en: to place something in a specific position
back_cards.example_en: She set the vase on the table carefully.
The team set a new sales target for the quarter.

back_cards.definition_en: to adjust a device to a particular configuration
back_cards.example_en: He set the thermostat to 72 degrees before leaving.

back_cards.definition_en: to prepare a stage or scene for an event
back_cards.example_en: The crew set the stage for the outdoor concert.

back_cards.definition_en: to fix a time or date for something
back_cards.example_en: They set the meeting for next Monday morning.

back_cards.definition_en: on the exterior or outer side of something
back_cards.example_en: The kids played outside the house all afternoon.

back_cards.definition_en: beyond the boundaries of a place
back_cards.example_en: The company expanded its operations outside the country.

back_cards.definition_en: not within a particular group or organization
back_cards.example_en: She sought advice from someone outside the team.

back_cards.definition_en: in the open air or natural environment
back_cards.example_en: The picnic was held outside under the trees.
Outside of work, he enjoys hiking and photography.

back_cards.definition_en: used to connect related ideas (abbreviation for 'et cetera')
back_cards.example_en: Bring pens, notebooks, et al., to the meeting.

back_cards.definition_en: indicating additional items in a list
back_cards.example_en: The store sells books, games, et more.

back_cards.definition_en: used to imply continuation of a pattern
back_cards.example_en: She packed clothes, shoes, et for the trip.

back_cards.definition_en: to reference similar things in a casual context
back_cards.example_en: We discussed movies, music, et during lunch.

back_cards.definition_en: used in academic citations for multiple authors
back_cards.example_en: The study by Smith et al. was published last year.

back_cards.definition_en: a plan to achieve a specific goal
back_cards.example_en: The company developed a strategy to increase market share.

back_cards.definition_en: a method used in competitive situations
back_cards.example_en: Her chess strategy outsmarted her opponent.
The team’s strategy focused on sustainable growth.

back_cards.definition_en: a way to organize resources effectively
back_cards.example_en: Their marketing strategy targeted young adults.
He devised a strategy to manage his workload.

back_cards.definition_en: in a way that is easy to understand
back_cards.example_en: She explained the concept clearly to the students.
The results clearly show a positive trend.

back_cards.definition_en: in a distinct or obvious manner
back_cards.example_en: The sign clearly marked the hiking trail.
He spoke clearly during the presentation.

back_cards.definition_en: in a way that is free from obstruction
back_cards.example_en: The sky was clearly visible after the storm.

back_cards.definition_en: something owned, like land or a building
back_cards.example_en: They bought a property by the lake.

back_cards.definition_en: a characteristic or attribute of something
back_cards.example_en: The material has the property of being lightweight.
She packed her property before moving out.

back_cards.definition_en: a piece of real estate for business
back_cards.example_en: The company leased a commercial property downtown.

back_cards.definition_en: a quality in a scientific context
back_cards.example_en: Water’s unique properties make it essential for life.
She lay the book on the coffee table.

back_cards.definition_en: to arrange or set something in place
back_cards.example_en: They lay the foundation for the new building.
The hen lay two eggs this morning.

back_cards.definition_en: to spread something over a surface
back_cards.example_en: He lay a blanket over the grass for the picnic.

back_cards.definition_en: to prepare or set up (e.g., a plan)
back_cards.example_en: They lay plans for the upcoming festival.

back_cards.definition_en: coming at the end of a series
back_cards.example_en: The final exam was scheduled for Friday.

back_cards.definition_en: concluding or last in a process
back_cards.example_en: The team made their final decision on the project.
Her final goal was to start her own business.

back_cards.definition_en: relating to a championship or decisive event
back_cards.example_en: The final match drew a huge crowd.
The contract’s terms were final and binding.

back_cards.definition_en: the power to make decisions or enforce rules
back_cards.example_en: The principal has authority over school policies.

back_cards.definition_en: an official organization or governing body
back_cards.example_en: The health authority issued new guidelines.
She is an authority on ancient history.
He lacked authority to sign the contract.

back_cards.definition_en: a person or group with control
back_cards.example_en: The city authority manages public transportation.
The cake was baked to a perfect golden brown.
This spot is perfect for a picnic.
She had perfect confidence in her team.
His performance was perfect on the guitar.
The weather was perfect for hiking.

back_cards.definition_en: a way of doing something systematically
back_cards.example_en: Her teaching method engaged all the students.

back_cards.definition_en: a technique used in a specific field
back_cards.example_en: Scientists developed a new method for testing.

back_cards.definition_en: an organized approach to a task
back_cards.example_en: He used a method to prioritize his work.

back_cards.definition_en: a process for achieving a goal
back_cards.example_en: Their method for solving conflicts was effective.
The study followed a rigorous scientific method.
The wine comes from the Tuscany region.

back_cards.definition_en: a part of a country or territory
back_cards.example_en: The northern region faces harsh winters.

back_cards.definition_en: an area defined by a characteristic
back_cards.example_en: This region is known for its forests.

back_cards.definition_en: a sector or zone in a system
back_cards.example_en: The brain’s frontal region controls planning.

back_cards.definition_en: a broad area of interest or activity
back_cards.example_en: Her research focuses on the region of public health.

back_cards.definition_en: from a specific time in the past until now
back_cards.example_en: She has lived here since 2015.

back_cards.definition_en: because or as a result of
back_cards.example_en: Since it was raining, we stayed indoors.

back_cards.definition_en: indicating a time after an event
back_cards.example_en: He’s been happier since starting his new job.
The town has grown since the highway was built.
Since you’re here, let’s start the meeting.
The new law had a big impact on businesses.
The car’s impact with the tree was severe.
Her speech made a lasting impact on the audience.
The factory’s impact on the river was concerning.

back_cards.definition_en: a result in a professional context
back_cards.example_en: His leadership had an impact on team morale.

back_cards.definition_en: to show or point out something
back_cards.example_en: The sign indicates the direction to the park.
Her tone indicated she was upset.
He indicated his agreement with a nod.

back_cards.definition_en: to signal in a technical context
back_cards.example_en: The gauge indicates low fuel levels.
The data indicates a rise in sales.
The neighborhood is safe for kids to play.
She kept her jewelry in a safe place.

back_cards.definition_en: not risky or likely to cause injury
back_cards.example_en: This medicine is safe for daily use.
His advice was a safe bet for success.
They arrived safe after the long journey.

back_cards.definition_en: a group formed to make decisions or plans
back_cards.example_en: The committee approved the new budget.

back_cards.definition_en: a team overseeing a specific task
back_cards.example_en: She joined the event planning committee.
The ethics committee reviews all complaints.

back_cards.definition_en: a group of experts or representatives
back_cards.example_en: The committee met to discuss policy changes.
He chairs the committee on urban development.

back_cards.definition_en: believed or assumed to be true
back_cards.example_en: The supposed benefits of the diet were unclear.

back_cards.definition_en: expected or required to do something
back_cards.example_en: You’re supposed to arrive by 9 AM.

back_cards.definition_en: thought to be but not confirmed
back_cards.example_en: The supposed leader of the group was absent.
The event was supposed to start at noon.
The supposed scandal caused a media frenzy.

back_cards.definition_en: a series of thoughts or images during sleep
back_cards.example_en: She had a dream about flying last night.
His dream is to become a doctor.
Owning a beach house is her dream.
The artist’s work felt like a dream.
The vacation was a dream come true.

back_cards.definition_en: the process of learning specific skills
back_cards.example_en: The company offers training for new employees.

back_cards.definition_en: preparation for a sport or activity
back_cards.example_en: She’s in training for the marathon.
His medical training took seven years.
The dog’s training improved its behavior.
The team underwent intensive sales training.
The dog left shit on the lawn.

back_cards.definition_en: a slang term for nonsense or rubbish
back_cards.example_en: Don’t believe that shit he’s saying.

back_cards.definition_en: a term for something of poor quality
back_cards.example_en: This old car is a piece of shit.

back_cards.definition_en: used to express frustration or trouble
back_cards.example_en: We’re in deep shit if we miss the deadline.

back_cards.definition_en: a casual term for stuff or things
back_cards.example_en: I need to clean up all this shit in my room.

back_cards.definition_en: located in the middle or core
back_cards.example_en: The hotel is in central London.
The central issue is lack of funding.

back_cards.definition_en: relating to a main system or hub
back_cards.example_en: The central office handles all complaints.

back_cards.definition_en: essential to an idea or process
back_cards.example_en: Trust is central to their partnership.
The city is central to the state’s economy.
You have the option to join the club.
The menu offers vegetarian options.
Her only option was to apologize.
The car comes with a sunroof option.

back_cards.definition_en: a right to buy or sell in finance
back_cards.example_en: He purchased stock options last month.
She has eight cats in her house.

back_cards.definition_en: a group or set of eight items
back_cards.example_en: The team won eight games this season.

back_cards.definition_en: a time or hour, as in 8 o’clock
back_cards.example_en: The meeting starts at eight tomorrow.
He bought eight pounds of apples.
She finished eighth in the race.

back_cards.definition_en: especially or to a great degree
back_cards.example_en: The movie was particularly exciting.

back_cards.definition_en: in a specific or distinct way
back_cards.example_en: She was particularly focused on details.
He was particularly tired after the hike.
This book is particularly helpful for beginners.

back_cards.definition_en: in a way that stands out
back_cards.example_en: Her speech was particularly memorable.
The room was completely silent during the test.
She completely changed her hairstyle.
The instructions were completely clear.
He was completely exhausted after the race.
I completely agree with your plan.
In my opinion, this is the best restaurant.

back_cards.definition_en: a view expressed by a group
back_cards.example_en: Public opinion favored the new policy.
The doctor gave her opinion on the injury.
His opinion on the issue sparked a discussion.
Her opinion of the movie was very positive.
The main reason for the delay was traffic.
The main entrance is around the corner.

back_cards.definition_en: central to an activity or process
back_cards.example_en: The main goal is to improve efficiency.

back_cards.definition_en: most significant in size or scope
back_cards.example_en: The main branch of the library is downtown.
The main ingredient in the recipe is flour.
She bought ten apples at the market.

back_cards.definition_en: a group or set of ten items
back_cards.example_en: The team scored ten goals this season.

back_cards.definition_en: a time or hour, as in 10 o’clock
back_cards.example_en: The store opens at ten in the morning.
The room is ten feet wide.
He ranked tenth in the competition.

back_cards.definition_en: a formal meeting for a job or role
back_cards.example_en: She prepared for her job interview all week.
The journalist conducted an interview with the mayor.

back_cards.definition_en: a discussion for media or research
back_cards.example_en: The TV interview aired last night.
The interview assessed her skills for the position.
The police interview lasted two hours.
Unicorns don’t exist in real life.
Some species exist only in remote areas.
Opportunities exist for skilled workers.
The tradition exists in many cultures.
Such problems exist in every organization.
She removed the dishes from the table.

back_cards.definition_en: to eliminate or get rid of
back_cards.example_en: They removed the old paint from the walls.
The board removed the CEO last month.

back_cards.definition_en: to take off clothing or items
back_cards.example_en: He removed his jacket before sitting down.

back_cards.definition_en: to extract in a technical context
back_cards.example_en: The surgeon removed the tumor successfully.
The room was too dark to read.
She wore a dark blue dress to the party.
The movie had a dark and eerie tone.

back_cards.definition_en: related to a lack of knowledge
back_cards.example_en: They were kept in the dark about the plan.
His dark expression worried his friends.

back_cards.definition_en: to engage in a game or sport
back_cards.example_en: The kids love to play soccer after school.

back_cards.definition_en: to perform music or act in a role
back_cards.example_en: She plays the piano beautifully.

back_cards.definition_en: to cause a device to operate
back_cards.example_en: He played the movie on his laptop.

back_cards.definition_en: to participate in a playful activity
back_cards.example_en: They play hide-and-seek in the park.

back_cards.definition_en: to have a role or effect
back_cards.example_en: Luck played a part in their success.
The union negotiated better wages for employees.
The union of the two companies was successful.

back_cards.definition_en: a group of states or nations
back_cards.example_en: The European Union promotes economic cooperation.
Their union strengthened the team’s efforts.

back_cards.definition_en: a state of harmony or agreement
back_cards.example_en: The family lived in union and peace.

back_cards.definition_en: a senior academic teacher at a university
back_cards.example_en: The professor lectured on physics.

back_cards.definition_en: an expert in a specific field
back_cards.example_en: She’s a professor of literature at the college.

back_cards.definition_en: a person with high academic rank
back_cards.example_en: The professor published a groundbreaking study.
He was a professor who inspired his class.

back_cards.definition_en: a title for a scholarly authority
back_cards.example_en: Professor Smith led the research team.
The pressure of the water burst the pipe.

back_cards.definition_en: stress or urgency in a situation
back_cards.example_en: She felt pressure to finish the project.

back_cards.definition_en: influence to act a certain way
back_cards.example_en: The team faced pressure to win the game.
The pressure dropped before the storm.
Work pressure kept him up at night.
The purpose of the meeting was to plan the event.
Her purpose in life is to help others.
The tool’s purpose is to cut wood.
He pursued his studies with great purpose.

back_cards.definition_en: the aim of an action or plan
back_cards.example_en: The campaign’s purpose was to raise awareness.
The actors performed on a large stage.
The project is in its final stage.
She’s at an early stage of her career.
The conference stage was beautifully decorated.

back_cards.definition_en: a level or point in a sequence
back_cards.example_en: The disease was caught at an early stage.

back_cards.definition_en: having the color of the sky or sea
back_cards.example_en: She wore a bright blue scarf.
He felt blue after the bad news.

back_cards.definition_en: related to a calm or serene mood
back_cards.example_en: The blue ocean was peaceful today.
The room was painted in blue shades.
He’s a true blue friend who never lets me down.

back_cards.definition_en: used to refer to a female person as the subject and object
back_cards.example_en: She treated herself to a new book.
She built the shelf herself.

back_cards.definition_en: used for a woman acting alone
back_cards.example_en: She went to the park by herself.
She was proud of herself for graduating.
She fixed the car herself without help.

back_cards.definition_en: the star at the center of our solar system
back_cards.example_en: The sun rises every morning.
We sat in the sun to warm up.

back_cards.definition_en: a source of light or energy
back_cards.example_en: The sun powered the solar panels.

back_cards.definition_en: a symbol of brightness or joy
back_cards.example_en: Her smile was like the sun on a cloudy day.

back_cards.definition_en: the sun’s position in the sky
back_cards.example_en: The sun sets behind the mountains.
The pain in her knee made walking difficult.
Losing her pet caused her great pain.

back_cards.definition_en: a source of annoyance or trouble
back_cards.example_en: Writing reports is such a pain.

back_cards.definition_en: a sensation from injury or illness
back_cards.example_en: The doctor asked about the pain’s intensity.
She took pains to make the event perfect.

back_cards.definition_en: a person who creates visual art
back_cards.example_en: The artist painted a stunning landscape.

back_cards.definition_en: a performer, such as a musician or actor
back_cards.example_en: She’s an artist who sings at local events.

back_cards.definition_en: someone skilled in a creative field
back_cards.example_en: The chef is an artist with flavors.
The writer was an artist with words.
The gallery showcased new artists.

back_cards.definition_en: a person who works for a company or organization
back_cards.example_en: The employee received a promotion.

back_cards.definition_en: someone hired for a specific role
back_cards.example_en: She’s an employee at the local bookstore.
The company hired ten new employees.

back_cards.definition_en: a team member in a workplace
back_cards.example_en: The employee suggested a new idea.

back_cards.definition_en: a person receiving wages for work
back_cards.example_en: All employees get health benefits.
She avoided the busy street during rush hour.
He avoided a collision by braking quickly.
They avoided talking about the issue.
She avoided answering the tough question.
He avoided social media to focus on work.
She checked her bank account balance.

back_cards.definition_en: a description or report of an event
back_cards.example_en: His account of the trip was fascinating.

back_cards.definition_en: a user profile on a platform
back_cards.example_en: She created an account on the website.
The firm manages several corporate accounts.

back_cards.definition_en: a statement of facts or reasons
back_cards.example_en: He gave an account of his actions to the team.

back_cards.definition_en: to set free or let go
back_cards.example_en: They released the bird back into the wild.

back_cards.definition_en: to make available to the public
back_cards.example_en: The band released a new album.
She released her stress by jogging.
The company released a new software update.

back_cards.definition_en: to allow to escape or flow
back_cards.example_en: The valve released steam from the pipe.

back_cards.definition_en: a sum of money for a specific purpose
back_cards.example_en: The fund supported local charities.
They created a fund for emergencies.
The research fund covered lab expenses.
She invested in a mutual fund.
The scholarship fund helped many students.
Protecting the environment is crucial.
The office environment was very welcoming.
The forest environment supports diverse wildlife.
The classroom environment encourages learning.
The economic environment impacted sales.
The doctor treated her injury quickly.

back_cards.definition_en: to behave toward someone in a certain way
back_cards.example_en: He treated his guests with kindness.

back_cards.definition_en: to give something as a reward or gift
back_cards.example_en: She treated herself to ice cream.

back_cards.definition_en: to deal with or handle a situation
back_cards.example_en: They treated the issue with urgency.
The wood was treated to resist water.
She gave specific instructions for the task.
This tool is specific to car repairs.
He asked for a specific type of coffee.
The rules are specific to this game.
Her request was specific and easy to follow.
This is the latest version of the app.
She read the English version of the novel.
The car comes in a hybrid version.
His version of the story differed.
The new version fixed all the bugs.

back_cards.definition_en: an attempt to hit a target
back_cards.example_en: He took a shot at the basketball hoop.
She captured a great shot of the sunset.
The doctor gave her a flu shot.
He ordered a shot of whiskey.

back_cards.definition_en: a try or attempt at something
back_cards.example_en: I’ll give it a shot and see what happens.
She hates doing chores on weekends.
He hates bullies who pick on others.
They hate the new company policy.
I hate the taste of olives.
She hates conflict and prefers peace.

back_cards.definition_en: the state of things as they actually exist
back_cards.example_en: The movie was far from reality.
She returned to reality after her daydream.
The reality is that we need more funds.
Virtual reality games are very immersive.
Her story had a ring of reality to it.

back_cards.definition_en: to go see someone or a place
back_cards.example_en: She visited her grandparents last weekend.
He visited Paris for three days.
I visited their website to learn more.
The doctor visited the patient at home.
A strange thought visited her mind.
She joined the book club at school.

back_cards.definition_en: a place for dancing or socializing
back_cards.example_en: They went to a club to celebrate.
The soccer club practices every evening.

back_cards.definition_en: a tool or weapon for striking
back_cards.example_en: The golfer chose a club for the shot.
The club hosted a charity event.
She fought for justice in her community.

back_cards.definition_en: the legal system or its application
back_cards.example_en: The court delivered justice to the victim.
Justice ensures everyone is treated fairly.
His punishment was seen as justice.
The justice system reformed over time.

back_cards.definition_en: a large flowing body of water
back_cards.example_en: The river runs through the city.
They kayaked down the river.

back_cards.definition_en: a source of life or resources
back_cards.example_en: The river supports local farming.
The river sparkled under the sunlight.
A river of people filled the streets.

back_cards.definition_en: the organ controlling thought and body
back_cards.example_en: The brain processes information quickly.
She’s the brain behind the new app.

back_cards.definition_en: a center of activity or control
back_cards.example_en: The computer is the brain of the system.
He’s a brain when it comes to math.
Exercise benefits both body and brain.
Her memory of the event was vivid.
That song brings back a fond memory.
The phone has 64GB of memory.
His memory improved with practice.
The statue was built in memory of the hero.

back_cards.definition_en: a solid piece of stone or mineral
back_cards.example_en: She picked up a smooth rock from the beach.
They listened to rock at the concert.
Her support was my rock during tough times.
The mountain is made of solid rock.
He skipped a rock across the lake.
They talk on the phone every evening.
We need to talk about your project.
She talks confidently during presentations.
They talk about their weekend plans.
He talked with the manager about a raise.
She bought a new camera for the trip.
The camera captured the live event.
The scientist used a camera to study wildlife.
The phone’s camera takes great pictures.
He used a camera to save family memories.
Climate change is a global issue.
The company has a global customer base.
The plan takes a global approach to health.
Global trade affects local markets.
The app gained global popularity quickly.
The store sells various types of bread.
She tried various methods to solve the puzzle.
Various colors were used in the painting.
He has various interests, like hiking and music.
The team came from various backgrounds.
The train will arrive at 6 PM.
She arrived late to the meeting.
He arrived as a star after the movie.
The moment to decide has arrived.
The package arrived at my house today.

back_cards.definition_en: to observe or become aware of
back_cards.example_en: She noticed a bird on the branch.
He didn’t notice the sign on the door.
They noticed her talent immediately.
I noticed a change in his behavior.
She noticed the painting’s fine details.
Add a bit of sugar to the recipe.
Wait a bit before calling again.

back_cards.definition_en: a part of a tool or machine
back_cards.example_en: The drill bit broke during use.
She did her bit to help the team.
The file size is measured in bits.

back_cards.definition_en: a specific fact or piece of information
back_cards.example_en: She shared every detail of the trip.

back_cards.definition_en: a small part of a larger whole
back_cards.example_en: The painting’s detail was impressive.
His work shows great attention to detail.

back_cards.definition_en: a particular element of a plan
back_cards.example_en: The contract’s details were finalized.
The dress had a delicate detail on the hem.
Climbing the mountain was a real challenge.
He accepted the chess challenge.
The team faced a challenge with funding.
The charity issued a challenge to raise money.

back_cards.definition_en: a test of skill or ability
back_cards.example_en: The puzzle was a fun challenge for kids.
They had an argument about the bill.

back_cards.definition_en: a reason or set of reasons
back_cards.example_en: Her argument convinced the committee.
The argument lasted for hours.

back_cards.definition_en: a logical case in a debate
back_cards.example_en: His argument was based on solid evidence.
The couple’s argument upset the guests.
She has a lot of books in her room.
They bought a lot to build a house.

back_cards.definition_en: a group of items or people
back_cards.example_en: This lot of apples is on sale.
His lot in life was to help others.
The car is in the lot behind the store.
Nobody answered the phone.
He felt like a nobody at the big event.
There was nobody in the room.
Nobody knew the answer to the question.
She went from a nobody to a star.

back_cards.definition_en: a tool used to harm or fight
back_cards.example_en: The soldier carried a weapon on duty.
The museum displayed ancient weapons.

back_cards.definition_en: a means to achieve an advantage
back_cards.example_en: Her wit was her greatest weapon.
The guard’s weapon was a stun gun.

back_cards.definition_en: something used to attack or protect
back_cards.example_en: Knowledge can be a powerful weapon.

back_cards.definition_en: of the highest quality or excellence
back_cards.example_en: This is the best pizza in town.
The best solution was to compromise.
She’s the best player on the team.
The best time to visit is spring.
He gave his best effort in the race.

back_cards.definition_en: a place for trains or buses
back_cards.example_en: The train leaves from the station at 8.
She listens to the local radio station.
The police station is nearby.
He stood at his station during the event.

back_cards.definition_en: a base or center of activity
back_cards.example_en: The research station is in the Arctic.

back_cards.definition_en: a piece of land surrounded by water
back_cards.example_en: They vacationed on a tropical island.
The house was an island of calm.

back_cards.definition_en: a landmass in a body of water
back_cards.example_en: The island is home to rare birds.
The kitchen island is great for cooking.
The island felt like a world apart.
I absolutely agree with your idea.
She’s absolutely the best candidate.
He was absolutely certain of his choice.
Do you like it? Absolutely!
The view was absolutely breathtaking.
Let’s walk instead of driving.
She chose tea instead of coffee.
He stayed home instead of going out.

back_cards.definition_en: used to suggest a different choice
back_cards.example_en: Try this app instead of that one.
They used email instead of letters.
The team had a discussion about the plan.

back_cards.definition_en: an exchange of ideas or opinions
back_cards.example_en: The discussion lasted for two hours.
The book sparked a discussion in class.
Their discussion resolved the conflict.
The discussion with the client went well.
She called instead of texting.
He bought a bike instead of a car.
They met online instead of in person.
Use honey instead of sugar.
I’ll go instead if you’re busy.
The weather can affect your mood.
The decision affected the whole team.
The movie affected her deeply.

back_cards.definition_en: to alter a situation or outcome
back_cards.example_en: New laws will affect businesses.
The issue doesn’t affect us directly.
The architect shared the house design.

back_cards.definition_en: the style or appearance of something
back_cards.example_en: The car’s design is sleek and modern.
Her dress design won an award.
The fabric has a floral design.
The website’s design is user-friendly.
She has a little dog that barks a lot.
There’s little time left to finish.
Her little brother is only five.
It’s just a little mistake, don’t worry.
He felt a little nervous before the speech.
It’s late, but I’ll go anyway.
Anyway, let’s talk about your plan.
She was tired but continued anyway.

back_cards.definition_en: used to conclude or move on
back_cards.example_en: I don’t know, but anyway, let’s eat.
He’ll find a way to do it anyway.
She didn’t respond to my question.
He responded quickly to the emergency.

back_cards.definition_en: to reply in writing or speech
back_cards.example_en: Please respond to the email by tomorrow.

back_cards.definition_en: to show a response to stimuli
back_cards.example_en: The patient responded well to treatment.
They responded to the customer’s complaint.

back_cards.definition_en: the power to manage or direct
back_cards.example_en: She has control over the project.
The remote control is on the table.
He lost control during the argument.
The thermostat is the temperature control.
The team took control of the situation.
She had trouble starting the car.
The protest caused trouble downtown.
It’s no trouble to help you move.

back_cards.definition_en: a source of worry or distress
back_cards.example_en: His health has been a trouble lately.
The machine is giving us trouble.
They had a long conversation over coffee.
The conversation turned to politics.
She enjoys deep conversations with friends.

back_cards.definition_en: a talk for a specific purpose
back_cards.example_en: The job interview was more like a conversation.
Their conversation lasted all evening.

back_cards.definition_en: to be in charge of or direct
back_cards.example_en: She manages a team of ten people.
He managed to finish the report on time.
They managed the crisis effectively.
She manages her schedule carefully.
He managed despite the challenges.
Please close the door quietly.
They closed the meeting with a vote.
She closed the book after reading.

back_cards.definition_en: to conclude a deal or agreement
back_cards.example_en: He closed the sale with a handshake.
The store closes at 9 PM.
The event is set for a later date.
They went on a date to the movies.

back_cards.definition_en: a point in time for an event
back_cards.example_en: The due date for the project is Friday.

back_cards.definition_en: a fruit from a palm tree
back_cards.example_en: She ate a sweet date for dessert.
The letter had no date on it.
Public opinion supported the new law.
The park is a public space for all.

back_cards.definition_en: funded or run by the government
back_cards.example_en: Public schools offer free education.
Her speech was a public success.
The meeting addressed public safety.
The army trained for months.

back_cards.definition_en: a group of people with a purpose
back_cards.example_en: An army of volunteers cleaned the park.
He joined the army after high school.
An army of ants marched across the yard.
The army of fans cheered loudly.
The flag is on top of the hill.

back_cards.definition_en: a piece of clothing for the upper body
back_cards.example_en: She wore a red top to the party.
He’s at the top of his class.
Put the top back on the jar.
The team reached the top of the league.

back_cards.definition_en: a piece of content shared online
back_cards.example_en: She shared a post on social media.
He applied for a teaching post.

back_cards.definition_en: a pole or stake in the ground
back_cards.example_en: The sign was attached to a post.

back_cards.definition_en: a place for guarding or observation
back_cards.example_en: The soldier stood at his post.
The post arrives at noon daily.

back_cards.definition_en: a fee or cost for something
back_cards.example_en: The charge for the ticket was $20.
She’s in charge of the project.
The police filed a charge against him.

back_cards.definition_en: a burst of energy or effort
back_cards.example_en: The team made a final charge to win.
The battery needs a full charge.
She took a seat by the window.
He won a seat on the council.
The theater has 500 seats.
I booked a seat for the concert.
The seat of the government is in the capital.
